story2scene.story:
Once upon a time there was a very brilliant girl named Sofia. Sofia was only three years old but she was already very smart!
One day, Sofia was sitting in her bedroom looking out of the window when all of a sudden, a man wearing a huge hat appeared. He was holding something in his hand.
He knocked on the door and said to Sofia, "I'm here to deliver your diary".
Sofia was very excited and smiled. She opened the door and the man handed her the diary.
Sofia thanked the man and he smiled. "You're very welcome," he said. And then he left with a wave.
Sofia ran back to her bedroom with her diary. She was so happy and couldn't wait to learn what was in it! As she opened it, she was sure that it was going to be brilliant. And she was right - the diary was filled with amazing stories and knowledge!
story2scene.step1_answer:
Once upon a time, there was a very brilliant girl named Sofia. Sofia was only three years old, but she was already very smart!
One sunny afternoon, Sofia was sitting in her bedroom looking out of the window when all of a sudden, a man wearing a huge hat appeared. He was holding a small brown rectangular package in his hand. 
He knocked on the door and said, "I'm here to deliver your diary, Sofia."
Sofia was very excited and smiled. She opened the door and the man handed her the small brown rectangular package.
Sofia thanked the man. He smiled warmly and said, "You're very welcome." Then, with a tip of his hat and a wave, he left.
Sofia ran back to her bedroom, holding the small brown rectangular package tightly. She was so happy and couldn't wait to learn what was in it! As she opened the package, Sofia's puppy Max bounded into the room, his tail wagging furiously.
"Look, Max, it's my new diary!" Sofia exclaimed, showing the puppy her beautiful blue square diary. The cover was decorated with a picture of a fairy tale castle. Sofia's eyes sparkled with excitement.
Max barked happily and jumped around, clearly sharing her enthusiasm. Sofia gently petted Max and said, "Let's see what's inside, Max."
She carefully opened the blue square diary and began to read. To her delight, it was filled with amazing stories and knowledge! There were tales of brave knights, adventurous explorers, and fascinating facts about the world. Each page seemed more wonderful than the last.
As Sofia read aloud to Max, she could feel her imagination soaring. The puppy listened intently, his ears perking up at every new story.
"Max, this is the best gift ever," Sofia said, hugging the puppy. Her heart was full of joy, and she knew that many adventures awaited them in the pages of her beautiful blue square diary.

story2scene.story:
Once there was a boy who loved playing in the mine. Every day he would fill up his bucket with dirt and rocks. Then he would run to the wealthy man's house to show him what he found.
The wealthy man was always happy to see the boy and he would give him a big smile. One day, as the boy arrived at the man's house, the man asked him to kneel down. The boy was confused but he obeyed.
The wealthy man told him that he should never be too proud of what he has, or the things he finds. He said that if the boy was humble and thankful, no matter what he had, he would always be wealthy in the eyes of God.
The boy thanked the man and ran off, much wiser than when he had arrived. From then on, the boy was ever thankful for all that he had. He remembered the man's words and kneeled everyday with thanks in his heart.
story2scene.step1_answer:
Once there was a boy named Tim who loved playing in the mine. Every day, Tim would fill up his red round bucket with dirt and rocks. Then he would run to Tim's uncle Mr. Green's house to show him what he found.
Tim's uncle Mr. Green was always happy to see Tim and he would give him a big smile. "Look what I found today, Uncle!" Tim would say, holding up his treasures.
One day, as Tim arrived at Tim's uncle Mr. Green's house, Tim's uncle Mr. Green asked him to kneel down. Tim was confused but he obeyed. "Why do I need to kneel, Uncle?" Tim asked.
Tim's uncle Mr. Green looked at Tim with kind eyes and said, "Tim, you should never be too proud of what you have or the things you find. If you stay humble and thankful, no matter what you have, you will always be wealthy in the eyes of those who love and care for you."
Tim thought about what Tim's uncle Mr. Green said and nodded. "Thank you, Uncle. I understand," Tim replied. He felt a new sense of wisdom and gratitude wash over him.
From that day on, Tim was always thankful for all that he had. He remembered Tim's uncle Mr. Green's words and kneeled every day with thanks in his heart. "I'm grateful for this red round bucket and all the little rocks I find," Tim would say to himself.
Tim's life was filled with joy as he continued to play in the mine, always bringing his discoveries to Tim's uncle Mr. Green. And every time Tim's uncle Mr. Green would smile, knowing that Tim had truly understood the importance of humility and gratitude.

story2scene.story:
John was playing in the living room. He was having lots of fun, touching all his toys. Suddenly, his mom walked into the room. She was holding a present. 
John said, "What is it, Mommy?"
Mom said, "It's a nice present for you!"
She put it in front of him and he touched it. It was very soft.
John said, "What is it?"
Mom said, "It's a cuddly bear. Would you like to take it to your room?"
John nodded and smiled. He hugged the bear and took it to his room. He found the perfect spot for it and put it down. It looked very nice in his room. 
John smiled and said, "I love it!"
story2scene.step1_answer:
John was playing in the living room. He was having lots of fun, touching all his toys. There were a yellow square block, a blue round ball, and a green toy car scattered around him. Suddenly, John's mom walked into the room, holding a present wrapped in bright red paper.
"What is it, Mommy?" John asked, his eyes wide with curiosity.
"It's a nice present for you!" she replied with a warm smile.
She placed the present in front of him. John touched the wrapping paper; it felt very soft. "What is it?" he asked again, his excitement growing.
"It's a cuddly bear," John's mom said. "Would you like to take it to your room?"
John nodded eagerly and grinned from ear to ear. He hugged the cuddly bear tightly and then dashed off to his room, clutching it in his arms. Once in his room, John looked around and found the perfect spot for his new friend—a cozy corner right beside his bed. He placed the cuddly bear there and stepped back to admire it.
"It looks very nice here," he said to himself, feeling proud.
Just then, John's dad appeared at the door. "What do you have there, John?" he asked, peeking inside.
"It's a cuddly bear! Mommy gave it to me," John explained, still beaming with joy.
John's dad smiled and walked in. "It's a fine-looking cuddly bear, John. I think you'll have lots of fun with it."
John nodded in agreement and hugged the cuddly bear once more. "I love it!" he declared happily.
That evening, as John was getting ready for bed, he made sure the cuddly bear was snug and safe in its special spot. He climbed into bed and gave the cuddly bear one last hug for the night. "Goodnight, cuddly bear," he whispered, and with that, he drifted off to sleep, dreaming of all the fun adventures he would have with his new best friend.
